channel.title: Emote teleport error and Command removing
channel.description:
ok well, i wanted to change one of the emote teleport from my source, so i went into client.java, searched the current coords, and just changed them to the new spot. now when i compile i get the error...
client.java:17226: illegal start of expression teleportToX = ;
i dont remember changing anything but the numbers of the coords, and i dont see how this could make an error. i moved the ';' around and it still is the same error. any help would be great.
also, ive decided to remove all commands from my server, so that it will have a better economy etc, and when i searched client.java for all the command names and stuff, i took it all out with no errors, basically removed everything that had to do with it, and after saving compiling and running, the commands work! you can type ::silab1 and go to the quest tab, scroll down, and click 'silab1'. both of them still work. pleasee help me out here, ive been struggling for days with this.

item.title: Emote teleport error and Command removing
item.dc:creator: @k0_twin k0 twin
item.description:
@k0_twin wrote:

thats just what the compiler says, this is what i have now im my client.java

else
{
teleportToX = 2512; (these are the new coords i added i)
teleportToY = 3866;
sendMessage(“Good Luck Doing Agility”);
updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}
break;

Read full topic
item.source: Emote teleport error and Command removing

item.title: Emote teleport error and Command removing
item.dc:creator: @Budda Budda
item.description:
@Budda wrote:

  1. “teleportToX = ;”? How can a number equal “;”?
  2. Go to:
public void customCommand

and delete everything in between the “{” and “}”. Make sure you’re compiling the right thing.

Read full topic
item.source: Emote teleport error and Command removing

item.title: Emote teleport error and Command removing
item.dc:creator: @k0_twin k0 twin
item.description:
@k0_twin wrote:

ok well, i wanted to change one of the emote teleport from my source, so i went into client.java, searched the current coords, and just changed them to the new spot. now when i compile i get the error…

client.java:17226: illegal start of expression
teleportToX = ;

i dont remember changing anything but the numbers of the coords, and i dont see how this could make an error. i moved the ‘;’ around and it still is the same error. any help would be great.

also, ive decided to remove all commands from my server, so that it will have a better economy etc, and when i searched client.java for all the command names and stuff, i took it all out with no errors, basically removed everything that had to do with it, and after saving compiling and running, the commands work! you can type ::silab1 and go to the quest tab, scroll down, and click ‘silab1’. both of them still work. pleasee help me out here, ive been struggling for days with this.
